main.controller

Class RequestHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.controller.RequestHandler

  • public class RequestHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Class handles front end requests, gets polygons based on extent+zoom+parameters level and generalizes them based on chosen operation. Ad-hoc generalization etc.-
    Author:
    Bernd Grafe

      • getJson

        public static java.lang.String getJson(java.lang.String modeS,
                                       java.lang.String minxS,
                                       java.lang.String minyS,
                                       java.lang.String maxxS,
                                       java.lang.String maxyS,
                                       java.lang.String scaleS,
                                       java.lang.String maxTypifyS,
                                       java.lang.String fixElementsS,
                                       java.lang.String minAreaS,
                                       java.lang.String minDistanceS,
                                       java.lang.String speedS,
                                       java.lang.String typmodeS,
                                       java.lang.String weightS,
                                       java.lang.String unionS,
                                       java.lang.String simplifyS)
                                throws org.codehaus.jackson.JsonParseException,
                                       org.codehaus.jackson.map.JsonMappingException,
                                       java.io.IOException
        get GeoJSON String based on parameters
        Parameters:
        modeS - preset modus: 0=all without any generalization / 1=selection - max Elements / 2=old bigger gets bigger typification (not recommended) /3=typification /4=pre-selection,typification, overlaps merge / 5=pre-selection, typification, overlaps merge, min area selection / 6=pre-select, union with max dist, typification, overlaps merge, min area selection / 7 = mode 5, shows diameter and supporting segments / 8 = mode 0, shows diameter and supporting segments / 9 = use pre processed cluster hierarchy
        minxS - minX
        minyS - minY
        maxxS - maxX
        maxyS - maxY
        scaleS - Scale 1:x
        maxTypifyS - default=30; set max Elements that should be typified
        fixElementsS - default=based on scale -> radical law; set total max elements shown
        minAreaS - default= 0.001; = 1 edge on square; minimum area for selection in map[m], not real[m]
        minDistanceS - default=0.0005; minimum distance for union
        speedS - default=320; transfer rate client-server in kbps
        typmodeS - modus of typification; 0=create new trees (recommended), better with weighting - 1=replace object in str-tree(experimental but slightly faster)
        weightS - default=0; if>0 - orientation of polygons is weighted with distance for nearest neighbor search
        unionS - default=-1, -1=deactivated; >=0 is maximum steps to merge nearest polygons with maximum distance
        simplifyS - default=1 1=activated; 0=deactivated; available for mode 5,6 and 9 - recursively simplifies polygon if transfer time to client is above 5 seconds
        Returns:
        GeoJSON String
        Throws:
        org.codehaus.jackson.JsonParseException
        org.codehaus.jackson.map.JsonMappingException
        java.io.IOException
